name: The Bellmoor Inn and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: except for thin walls and a noisy HVAC unit. For the most part, this place is very nice...plenty of parking in the above-ground or underground lots, many luxurious, comfortable public rooms --- library, living area, porches. There's a beautiful garden with lots of outdoor seating, a koi pond, outdoor swimming pool and year-round hot tub. The meeting rooms are very nice too.
reviews.title: An oasis...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a garden room that was small, but nicely outfitted - queen bed with quilt. Wifi available at no extra cost throughout the hotel. Sink outside the bathroom. Super clean! Showerhead not to my taste & too high for me to reach - but, some might like the spray. Waffleweave robes and hooks & bars for towels.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay
"Beautiful Rooms,Wonderful Staff,Awesome Cookies"
reviews.text: Staff was nice - no complaints.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coffee & tea service available in the lobby 24 hours --- but, the water was definitely lukewarm on multiple occasions. Nice selection of teas.
reviews.title: We miss it already!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night in April while visiting the area and enjoying the local retail outlets. We booked 4th floor room, which is restricted to " adult only" bookings. Location was very nice, easy walking distance to area restaurants and beach/boardwalk. Stayed in Aspen room after small concern with originally booked Fresco room. After checking in to the Fresco room, I notice a few small ants near the sliding door to the balcony. I brought my concern to the front desk personnel and they quickly suggested moving rooms. I was offered & shown 2 different rooms, one definitely an upgrade room, but I just changed to same category room. Why? Because comp same catagory room size, decor and over comfort were great, so I didn't feel I needed to upgrade. The decor is lovely and the bedding & linens are very comfortable. Breakfast is served 7:00--10:30am with self-serve buffet, scrambled eggs, bacon, cinnamon oatmeal, pancakes, breads/bagels/muffins, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, OJ, coffee/tea. Plenty of seating as the hotel was not full. The grounds/court yard are relaxing with multiple seating areas around small fountains, some with koi fish. Would definitely stay here again. Quaint & comfortable on multiple levels. Only negative was the very loud AC/Heating system in room. Also the location of the air vents is almost directly over the bed, so you both hear & feel the forced air when system kicks on. Would find the problematic with longer stays.
reviews.title: home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We visited over Thanksgiving vacation last fall and am sorry that I'm just now writing a review. When you arrive at the hotel, the outside doesn't look that impressive. The inside is an entirely different story! It's amazing. I don't know where to begin. Service was amazing every time we encountered a hotel employee. The room itself was nice---we didn't do the concierge level but that also sounded wonderful. I loved the fact that the hotel had different comfortable common rooms---my favorite was a room with games and a fireplace and newspapers to read, very comfy in cool weather. The room we stayed in was very comfortable and nice, even for two grown-ups and a little kid (sometimes that can be a little cramped but not at the Bellmoor). We really enjoyed the afternoon "tea" and my daughter loved trying the tea and the mini cupcakes, which were refreshed whenever necessary. Breakfast was served in the same area and was amazingly extensive. Nice areas to sit in with your family, either at regular tables or on a little porch-type area. Omelet station, lots of options to choose from, and multiple newspapers to choose from. Loved it! Great atmosphere and really nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside of the Bellmoor looks ordinary and uninteresting, so prepare yourself for a shock when you go inside! Every space is decorated with taste and imagination. In the lobby, sofas and chairs are covered in leather or luxury fabrics, oriental rugs cover some of the rich hardwood floors, and walls boast stunning bird prints. Our room was no exception--see below.
reviews.title: Just beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checkin was smooth; we were directed to the parking garage where we were met by a bellman who whisked our baggage to our room while we rode the paneled passenger elevator. Even the elevator had an oriental rug! On the 4th floor, we found that our Roanoke Suite was beyond expectation. The carpet was a new-looking sisal clone (soft and pretty); the furniture was covered in expensive fabrics and the window treatments looked brand-new. All the walls were covered in new-looking grasscloth. We had a full kitchen (we used the fridge and the dishes and cutlery) and two full bathrooms, one attached to each king bedroom. The bathrooms were nice-sized and well-appointed: Tile floors, excellent towels, nice toiletries, good lighting. The best part of the suite was the fireplace. Overall the suite was so cozy and pretty we didn't want to leave it for dinner, so we got Chinese carryout from Confucius nearby (recommended by Jim at the front desk).
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spa treatments ranged from amazing to very good. My massage with Eydie was transcendent and my mani/pedi were pleasant but didn't last long. We did not try the hot tub.
reviews.title: The Bellmoor Inn is a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a treat! The omelet bar attendants will make just about anything; all the add-ins looked fresh and appealing. On the cold table, we found yogurt with a selection of really good fresh fruit and granola, packaged cereal, lovely pastries, delicious biscuits, and so-so muffins. On the hot table, we found excellent sausages, fluffy fresh pancakes, and a surprising and delicious bread pudding. Coffee was good, OJ was thin and flavorless. Everthing was replenished promptly and tables were kept very clean. Newspapers were provided. Oddly, it was very difficult to find salt and pepper for the eggs.
reviews.title: Nice Enough but Too Expensive and HIDDEN FEES!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I usually do not stay at the Bellmoor Inn during the summer months because it is very expensive. The 9% service charge is rather steep. However, my favorite Bed and Breakfast in Rehoboth does not accept children. The Bellmoor Inn is beautiful. The yard with little waterfalls ,flowers and bushes is lovely. The rooms are large and very clean. The breakfast is OK. I just wish they would serve some pastry rather than the same little muffins and sticky buns. However, there is always yogurt and fruit besides the usual breakfast food.
reviews.title: Nice but Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recent trip to the Bellmoor was quite a disappointment, and not worth the price, I'm sorry to say. If you have stayed at any four- or five-star establishments and are expecting similar standards, please beware. This is a beach hotel, and for beach standards, about as good as it gets -- but you're getting a beach hotel with some fancy trappings
reviews.title: Nice, but no four-star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bellmoor has a nice library, antiques, fancy rugs, a quaint outdoor area with tables and pond. They have refreshments every day at 3, which consist of some cookies and tea that all the kids will come out for. Those children will also make a lot of noise while you are trying to eat breakfast and read your paper. Those same children will also be out in the "garden area" making noise while you are at the adult pool -- which is little more than a small kiddie pool three feet deep surrounded by a bunch of lawn chairs and a fence.
reviews.title: Upscale B&B at the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fourth floor, or club suite, are the only rooms with safes. It would have been nice to have one in our $359-a-night room, especially when the maid left our room's door ajar after cleaning it. But I guess you have to spend over $400 a night to be considered worthy enough to have a safe. Funny, but any Hilton at half the price has a safe in every room.
reviews.title: Nice but Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, beware of the 9% extra tax they put on your bill as a "courtesy" to you so they can tip all the wonderful staff that serves you. Problem is, there's no staff that serves you. We had one bellman carry our bags after I wasn't happy with the first room they gave us that they had told us was over 400 sq. feet, which in actuality was only a little over 400. They were counting the porch as living area! So they moved us to another room that had a view of the parking lot across the street. Every morning we had breakfast "servers" who were all talking in the kitchen area. I saw one who took our plates away one morning, and I saw another one replenish some coffee. Gee, that was SO worth 9% of my bill! Unbelievable.
reviews.title: good location, upmarket country house decor with disappointing food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two days/three nights at the bellmoor for a weekend getaway for our anniversary. We like to come to Rehoboth in the fall or early spring outside of the beach season and have stayed at a few properties in the neighborhood of Bellmoor, but this was the first stay there. I chose it primarily because of its location ( close to the beach and shops) and because the room rate includes a full hot breakfast each morning ( which my wife enjoys ). However, the rate was a bit high for the end of the season, but the hotel seemed to be at capacity the weekend we were there. Check in was quick and easy. We had a king deluxe room with a sofa that overlooked the courtyard/patio. The room was a good size, but the sofa and desk were in an odd configuration very close to the bed, so we actually re-arranged the furniture to have a more open space and it made it much more pleasant. My two main complaints about the room was the double-doored armoire, which held the tv, was cheap and flimsy. The drawers were loose and hard to open and close and the look and feel of the thing was pretty downscale for the $239 (friday) and $269(saturday) room rates we paid. Second was the air conditioner was a noisy old under the window type unit ; again, it gave the room a cheaper than expected feel. Other than those two things, we had a nice stay. The hotel has some great common areas for sitting and reading indoors and out on the courtyard or in the pool deck. We found the staff great and helpful and well informed. They gave us a nice restaurant recommendation on the night of our anniversary. I would recommend the Bellmoor for an adult getaway, especially if you can get a discounted rate.
reviews.title: Relaxing and great location Oct1- Oct3

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This inn offers all the amenities of a charming country B&B but right in the heart of Rehoboth Beach. The location allows for easy walking to the beach, shopping and dining which if you know Rehoboth, you know how difficult parking can be during peak times.
reviews.title: Continued Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have stayed here previously and the service continues to be excellent. The staff is friendly and pleasant and will take the time to review dining and activity options to best suggest a venue that will meet your needs. The rooms and grounds are kept very clean.
reviews.title: First B&B Experience and Exceeded Our Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed on the fourth floor was a two bedroom suite with a separate kitchen and living room. The kitchen is a full kitchen so if you were staying for an extended period of time you could actually prepare meals if you have special diet restrictions. The fourth floor is also child free and offers a private library where snacks and soft drinks are provided free of charge.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Will Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn offers a spa and fitness area on the 2nd floor. The gym is tiny and probably not worth the trip but the spa services were fairly priced and enjoyable. Also offered are two pools, one hot tub and a large library. The pools are small but one is adult only and private which is a nice feature.
reviews.title: Wonderful, comfortable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a quick stay at the Bellmore, just for a getaway night during a spring vacation. We were surprised how crowded the town was during the off-season, and enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the location. The hotel was charming, clean and inviting. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was more than we expected. The 3pm cookies were a lovely bonus. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel with the feel of a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this property! Gracious staff, elegant lobby, charming & impeccably cleaned guest rooms, delicious breakfast spread, and perfect location. Our room was a garden room -- we were very happy with our choice. The room wasn't large, but was in a beautiful part of the hotel and was very recently updated. Loved the 'sense of place' created by the hotel -- I will think back to our room at the Bellmoor when I think of Rehoboth. It was simply perfect.
reviews.title: Lovely inn, right in the heart of Rehoboth...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Great place to stay. Very close to the boardwalk and all the shops. A little pricey and hot water takes a while to get going for your shower.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in Rohoboth Beach and we could not have been happier with our choice of Inns. The room was beautiful, bed was comfortable, breakfast a nice plus. The staff was great! The front desk staff were so personable and always steered us in the right direction on where to eat. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Our stay at the Bellmoor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: I can't say enough about the hospitality here. Rooms clean and comfy. Very quiet and realaxing.. Just perfect!
reviews.title: Perfect for picky travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My partner and I took our boys for a long weekend. I rarely write reviews though felt compelled to do so. We had a wonderful stay.everything was great but the service was outstanding. Better than many ritz carlton's and four seasons where I have stayed.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised! Superb service, beautiful maintained and convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's great for families or couples. If going sans kids, book the adult only floor. Enjoy!
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my husband said to me when we settled into our room yesterday, "What a find!" We're so excited about The Bellmoor that I'm writing this review during our stay via in-room wireless internet. (Always a plus for this wired couple.) For our anniversary we were looking for a relaxing getaway with a spa and within driving distance from home. Check, check, and check!
reviews.title: Fabulous Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service is fab in all areas - laid back yet excellent, friendly yet unobtrusive. Ambiance is excellent, old world meets 21st century. The complimentary full breakfast in the Garden Room offers a variety of selections to suit all preferences.
reviews.title: Great escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009
reviews.text: Our room on the 4th/Club floor, is beautifully decorated and incredibly clean. Thank you housekeeping! When travelling we believe that cleanliness is next to godliness so the pristene bathroom is much appreciated. Another great feature about the 4th floor is that it's for adults and only adults. Makes us feel special. A nice feature when you want to sleep in or get away without the children or grandchildren.
reviews.title: Lovely Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, my husband's and my stay at the Bellmoor was most enjoyable and relaxing. Our room was very nice and the cushy bed is a dream to sleep in. The two common rooms off the lobby are so cozy. We very much enjoyed sitting in front of the fires built by the night staff in the "library." The front-desk staff are always personable, helpful, and engaging. In fact, everyone providing services at the Bellmoor--front desk, spa, cleaning, and breakfast service--do a great job. Oh, and those delicious cookies served every afternoon are a special treat!
reviews.title: Such Hospitable Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Margaret R
reviews.title: Nicest place in Rehoboth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last spring was the first time we stayed at the Bellmoor and we are sold, it's now the only place we will stay. Wonderful staff, beautiful rooms, and the spa??? Wow. We will be back soon and I can't wait. Thanks to all.
reviews.title: A must stay place when visiting Rehoboth Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our 18th stay at the Bellmoor Inn and Spa. It always begins by a warm greeting and a room that is clean and welcoming. On this visit in mid-March we asked if certain establishments were open. One of the staff members made two phone calls to find out. The buffet breakfast is always a treat with fresh fruit and a variety of breakfast items from scrambled eggs, french toast, bagels, yogurt, etc. We noticed a nice upgrade since our last visit that included a new flat screen television.
reviews.title: Quiet luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Bellmoor is like being a guest in someone's country home. We are just back from our 5th sisters' getaway over the past 7 years and we are already planning for next year. The staff quietly attends to your every need. The bedrooms are lovely, the common areas are inviting, with plenty of nooks and crannies for private conversation, and the breakfasts are wonderful. Afternoon tea is a lovely touch. If the Rehoboth Beach weather is less than ideal, it is no compromise to return to the hotel and settle in the library/game room in front of the fire with a good book, or head to the hot tub or spa. A stay at the Bellmoor is the ultimate in relaxation and worth the splurge.
reviews.title: Our favorite place in Rehoboth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a quick one night stay in Rehoboth over Easter weekend. We wanted to get away with our two boys (5yrs, 21mo) to spend some time at the beach and boardwalk. We picked the Bellmoor from my sister's recommendations. It was beautiful and we loved it! I booked a one BR suite. The room was large, and both the king bed and pull out were comfortable. Breakfast was really great and the staff was attentive and friendly. The location is very convenient to the main street in Rehoboth and the boardwalk. This place is very charming, and we will be back for sure!
reviews.title: Lovely inn, lots of charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our two nights at The Bellmoor were very enjoyable. We stayed on the 4th floor which is the "club level" and can only be accessed by those guests staying on that floor via their hotel key. We stayed in the Jackson suite which had a huge bed, fire place, fridge and jet tub in the bathroom. There was a cute study / library on that floor which had books, board games and snacks available 24 / 7 (soda's, waters, packaged cookies, chip's, etc). The bed was very comfortable with expensive linens, my only complaint about the room would be the noise of the AC / heat unit, it woke me up quite a few times but I am a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Short stay at The Bellmoor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The service at the hotel was wonderful from the front desk staff to the servers at breakfast to the employees at the spa. Everyone was eager to help and very polite.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was unfortunately not that great. There was coffee and tea, a selection of cereals, fresh fruit, and store bought pastries. On Friday morning there was scrambled eggs, bacon, grits and french toast. On Saturday there was an omelet station, sausages and pancakes. I was hoping for "home baked" items instead of store bought. On Saturday it was much busier and I noticed that many people were struggling to find a table.
reviews.title: Quiet old style elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very convenient for the beach, restaurants, shops, etc. Since it was out of season when we visited and the weather was still too cold for sunbathing and swimming at the beach, we visited the Nassau Winery and DogFish Head Brewery instead. The brewery is about a 25 minute drive from the Bellmoor but well worth it! We managed to get on a tour which was pretty interesting (and free might I add) which included beer samples. Our tour guide was a ton of fun and very knowledgeable. The winery was quaint and the owner was very chatty, I did buy a bottle of the sweet red and sweet white wine.
reviews.title: Outstanding

description: The Bellmoor Inn, a seaside resort, a non-smoking hotel that has the look and feel of a modern stylish inn while offering the service and privacy of a small European hotel. A Rehoboth Beach Inn for decades, it has been reborn as the newest with the completion of 78 elegant rooms, suites, and luxurious amenities. A garden spot seemingly far removed from ocean resort activity, yet only a short walk to the beach and the town's renowned boutiques, restaurants, galleries and coffee houses. Offering you the coziness of a bed-and-breakfast with the service and luxury of a five star hotel. Nearby Airports* Salisbury Airport - 45 miles* Balltimore/Washington International (MD) - 100 miles* Philadelphia International (PA) - 100 miles.
